## Melee
| Roll | Mishap |
|------|--------|
| 1    | You throw your weapon, it lands 1d10 feet away. |
| 2    | You swing too hard and lose your balance, falling prone. |
| 3    | Your weapon gets stuck in an adjacent object, taking an action to dislodge. |
| 4    | You accidentally hit an ally within 5ft of you. |
| 5    | Your weapon becomes slippery and is dropped, taking your next turn to pick it up. |
| 6    | You strike yourself in confusion, dealing the weapon's damage to yourself. |
| 7    | You swing too wildly, hitting nothing but air and losing your next attack. |
| 8    | Your weapon bends or breaks, becoming unusable until repaired. |
| 9    | You lose focus and become disoriented, gaining disadvantage on your next attack roll. |
| 10   | Your weapon hits a solid object (rock, tree, etc.) and vibrates in your hands, stunning you for 1 round. |
| 11   | You strike the ground, sending dirt and debris into your eyes, blinding you for 1 turn. |
| 12   | You swing too hard, slamming your weapon against your knee, causing 1d6 damage. |
| 13   | You accidentally hit an object that unleashes a cloud of poison gas, save against being poisoned. |
| 14   | Your weapon strikes a cursed object, causing it to cling to you until removed with remove curse. |
| 15   | Your weapon becomes electrified and shocks you, causing 1d8 lightning damage. |
| 16   | You become overzealous, pushing yourself into a rage and losing control of your character for 1 turn. |
| 17   | You slip on a wet patch on the ground, falling prone. |
| 18   | Your weapon strikes a loose stone, causing a small cave-in that buries you for 1 turn. |
| 19   | You swing too early or too late, causing a momentary decrease in AC. |
| 20   | Your weapon hits a rune-protected stone, causing an explosion, saving throw for half damage. |

**Note**: All damage values assumed to be handled by game systems, and are presented only as suggested options.

## Ranged
# d100 Mishaps due to a Critical Failure on a Ranged Attack

1. Your bowstring snaps and you take 1d4 piercing damage from the recoil.
2. Your arrow hits an ally within 10 feet of your target. Roll to see who gets hit.
3. Your arrow ricochets off a nearby rock and hits a random target within 20 feet.
4. A gust of wind throws off your shot and the arrow lands harmlessly 10 feet to the left.
5. The arrow you nocked was already damaged and breaks upon firing.
6. Your quiver falls apart and arrows scatter in every direction.
7. You accidentally fire the arrow backwards, hitting a random target behind you.
8. A bird swoops down and intercepts your arrow mid-flight.
9. You get distracted and accidentally shoot a friendly NPC instead of the intended target. Roll to determine the NPC's injury.
10. Your bowstring flies off, striking a random character within 10 feet for 1d4 bludgeoning damage.
11. Your arrow ricochets off a wall and lands at your feet.
12. Your bow collapses into shards, dealing 2d6 piercing damage to you.
13. Your arrow misses and strikes a beehive, attracting an angry swarm of bees.
14. Your arrow hits an enemy's shield, alerting the enemy to your presence.
15. Your bowstring becomes tangled, preventing you from firing for 1d4 rounds.
16. A nearby warlock accidentally curses your arrow with a random spell up to 2nd level.
17. You trip and accidentally shoot your ally in the back for 1d6 piercing damage.
18. You accidentally shoot your boot, dealing 1d4 piercing damage to yourself.
19. Your shot is just a little too strong, with the arrow sailing over the horizon never to be seen again.
20. Your shot misses the enemy, but hits a random piece of explosive debris which detonates for 2d6 fire damage to everyone within 10 feet.

## Arcane
# d100 Arcane Attack Critical Failure Mishaps

1. You accidentally teleport to a nearby location and cannot return to your original spot for the next hour.
2. Your arcane energies backfire and you become stunned for one round.
3. You overload your senses with magical energy, causing vision impairment for the next minute.
4. Your magical attack hits a nearby ally instead of the enemy.
5. You unintentionally summon a minor demon or elemental, which immediately attacks you.
6. Your spell creates a loud, obnoxious noise that can be heard up to a mile away.
7. Your target is surrounded by a barrier of magical force, making it almost invulnerable for the next minute.
8. Your magical attack triggers a wild surge that affects everyone within 30 feet of you.
9. Your attack misfires, causing you to become vulnerable to the same magical damage type for the next minute.
10. You lose your concentration and suffer from a sudden headache, causing you to take 1d6 psychic damage.
11. You accidentally open a portal to another realm that sucks in one random person or object within 10 feet of you.
12. Your spell fizzles out and you suffer from a disruption in your magical abilities, causing you to be unable to cast spells for the next turn.
13. You accidentally polymorph yourself into a harmless creature, such as a mouse or a frog, for the next minute.
14. Your spell was too powerful and now there's a slight chance of a magical storm in the next 24 hours.
15. A swarm of magical insects appears and begins to attack everyone within 20 feet of you.
16. Your magical energy causes a localized earthquake, knocking everyone in the vicinity prone.
17. Your spell hits a nearby object, breaking it into pieces and causing loud noises that alert others to your presence.
18. Your magical energy lingers and causes a small fire to start that quickly spreads out of control.
19. Your spell backlashes and causes one of your senses, chosen randomly, to be impaired for the next 10 minutes.
20. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to take 1d8 force damage.
21. Your spell triggers a magical chain reaction, causing all magical items within 10 feet to cease functioning for the next hour.
22. Your magical energy causes all metal objects within 15 feet to glow brightly for the next minute.
23. Your spell causes the ground beneath your feet to become slippery and difficult to stand on.
24. You accidentally summon a flock of annoying birds that disrupt your attempts to be stealthy.
25. Your spell causes a localized breach in reality, causing strange and disturbing sounds to emanate from the area for the next hour.
26. Your magical energy causes all the plants within 30 feet to wither and die.
27. You accidentally instantaneously age yourself by 10 years.
28. Your spell causes a burst of intense light that blinds all creatures within 20 feet for one round.
29. Your magical attack causes the ground beneath the target to bubble and turn into a small pool of acid.
30. Your spell causes a loud and unsettling noise that can be heard up to a mile away.
31. Your magical energy causes your hair to stand on end and gives you a static shock.
32. Your spell creates a bright and colorful display of lights that have no real effect.
33. You accidentally summon an impish prankster who will cause mayhem for the next 24 hours.
34. Your magical energy causes a magical labyrinth to appear around the target.
35. Your spell triggers a chain of magical illusions that affect everyone within 30 feet of you.
36. You lose control of your magical energy and create a small crater in the ground.
37. Your magical attack causes an unsettling silence to fill the area for the next minute.
38. Your spell causes a hazy mist to envelope the area, making visibility difficult.
39. Your magical energy causes water within 20 feet of you to become purified.
40. Your spell creates a blinding flash of light that makes it difficult to see for the next round.
41. You accidentally summon a benevolent spirit that offers advice and guidance for the next hour.
42. Your magical energy causes a small gust of wind that forces everyone within 15 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.
43. Your spell causes a loud and unsettling scream that can be heard up to a mile away.
44. Your magical attack causes an unsettling feeling to affect everyone within 30 feet of the target.
45. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become disorientated for one round.
46. Your spell causes a large, colorful explosion that has no real effect.
47. Your magical energy causes the target to rapidly age by 10 years.
48. Your spell creates a distracting echo that lasts for the next round.
49. You accidentally summon a harmless animal, such as a rabbit or a songbird.
50. Your magical energy causes a bizarre and unsettling smell to permeate the area.
51. Your spell creates a harmless but blinding burst of light.
52. Your magical attack causes a localized tornado that knocks everyone within 20 feet of the target prone.
53. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become frightened for one round.
54. Your spell causes a burst of intense cold that freezes everything within 10 feet of the target.
55. Your magical energy causes all the objects within 20 feet to levitate for the next minute.
56. Your spell causes a deafening boom that echoes through the area for the next minute.
57. You accidentally summon a friendly elemental that offers its assistance for the next 24 hours.
58. Your magical attack causes the ground beneath the target to become a muddy, difficult terrain.
59. Your spell creates a burst of vibrant colors that blinds all those who see it for one round.
60. Your magical energy causes everyone within 20 feet of you to become insubstantial for one round.
61. Your spell causes a sudden and intense heat wave that makes it difficult to breathe for the next round.
62. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become confused for one round.
63. Your magic creates a harmless, miniature copy of yourself nearby.
64. Your magical energy causes a sudden and powerful gust of wind that blows everyone within 15 feet of you backward.
65. Your spell causes intense vibrations within the ground that cause everyone within 30 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
66. You accidentally summon a harmless object, such as a pillow or a piece of fruit.
67. Your magical attack causes everyone within 20 feet of the target to become deafened for one round.
68. Your spell causes a burst of intense heat that sets nearby objects on fire.
69. Your magical energy causes a sudden and strong current of water to sweep everyone within 15 feet of you off their feet.
70. Your spell causes a sudden and total darkness to envelop the area.
71. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become paralyzed for one round.
72. Your magical attack causes the ground beneath the target to become unstable and difficult to stand upon.
73. Your spell causes a sudden and intense burst of light that causes those who witness it to become stunned for one round.
74. Your magical energy causes a sudden and powerful gust of wind that blows everyone within 15 feet of you backward.
75. You accidentally summon a harmless creature, such as a butterfly or a gnat.
76. Your spell causes everyone within 20 feet of the target to become slowed for one round.
77. Your magical attack causes a sudden and frenzied flurry of snow that temporarily blinds everyone within 30 feet.
78. Your spell causes a sudden and spectacular explosion that has no real effect.
79. Your magical energy causes the target's shadow to detach and become a solid, inherently malevolent creature that attacks the target for one minute.
80. Your magic causes a harmless, miniature monster to appear nearby.
81. Your spell creates a burst of harmless but unsettling images and sounds.
82. Your magical energy causes a sudden and intense gust of wind that whips through the area.
83. Your spell causes a sudden and unexpected burst of rain to drench everyone within 15 feet of you.
84. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become nauseated for one round.
85. Your magical attack causes a sudden and powerful gust of wind to rush forward and knock everyone within 30 feet back.
86. Your spell causes a sudden and frenzied flurry of hail that temporarily blinds everyone within 30 feet.
87. Your magical energy causes all living creatures within 10 feet of the target to become insubstantial for one round.
88. Your spell creates a harmless but audible echo that resonates throughout the area for the next minute.
89. You accidentally summon a harmless object, such as a stick or a pebble.
90. Your magical attack causes everyone within 20 feet of the target to become paralyzed for one round.
91. Your spell causes a burst of harmless but uncomfortable sensations, such as goosebumps or a shudder.
92. Your magical energy causes a sudden and unexpected gust of wind that causes everyone within 10 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw or become knocked prone.
93. Your spell causes a harmless but blinding beam of light to emit from your hand.
94. You imbue yourself with too much magical power, causing you to become dazed for one round.
95. Your magical attack causes the ground beneath the target to become suffused with water and slippery.
96. Your spell causes a sudden and violent surge of water to sweep through the area.
97. Your magical energy causes the target to burst into sudden, frenzied movement for one round before collapsing exhausted.
98. Your spell creates a harmless but intense burst of flame.
99. You accidentally summon a harmless illusion, that can only be seen by you.
100. Your magical attack causes the ground beneath the target to become dangerously unstable and difficult to stand upon.

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 01         | Aela | This aasimar has stunning golden eyes and long, curly blonde hair that frames their delicate, high-cheekboned face. They carry themselves with a regal, confident air and wear flowing robes reminiscent of those worn by high priests. |
| 02         | Erevan | This aasimar has piercing blue eyes and a mop of wild, curly black hair. They have a lean, muscular build and wear fitted leather armor that highlights their toned figure. They exude an electrifying energy that draws people to them. |
| 03         | Iliana | This aasimar has striking emerald green eyes and long, straight silver hair. They have a serene, peaceful aura that puts others at ease, and they dress in simple, flowing white robes. They are often seen helping those in need or tending to the sick. |
| 04         | Kael | This aasimar has piercing grey eyes and short, spiky platinum blonde hair. They have a rugged, handsome appearance and wear studded leather armor. They are known for their bravery in battle and their fierce loyalty to their allies. |
| 05         | Lirien | This aasimar has deep brown eyes and wavy, honey-brown hair. They have a warm, friendly demeanor and wear brightly colored clothing that reflects their playful nature. They are known for their sense of humor and their love of pranks. |
| 06         | Mirielle | This aasimar has dramatic, almond-shaped eyes that change color from blue to green depending on the light. They have long, flowing black hair and delicate features that give them an otherworldly appearance. They dress in intricate, elegant clothing and are often seen at high society gatherings. |
| 07         | Naia | This aasimar has bright hazel eyes and long, curly red hair. They have a bubbly, effervescent personality that can turn heads and lighten hearts. They wear comfortable clothes that allow them to move freely, and they often use their talents to entertain crowds or cheer on their allies. |
| 08         | Rhiannon | This aasimar has bold, striking blue eyes and short, choppy silver hair. They have a fierce, fiery personality that can be both inspiring and intimidating. They wear black leather clothing and wield powerful weapons with ease. They are known for their ferocity on the battlefield and their unyielding determination. |
| 09         | Sariel | This aasimar has a serene, otherworldly beauty that is accentuated by their piercing green eyes and long, silver hair that falls in soft waves around their face. They dress in light, flowing garments that are adorned with moonstones and silver thread. They have an affinity for the celestial realm and often venture there to seek guidance or commune with their angelic ancestors. |
| 10         | Thalia | This aasimar has striking violet eyes and long, flowing burgundy hair. They have a regal, elegant appearance and dress in luxurious silks and velvets that accentuate their high cheekbones and graceful figure. They are known for their poise and grace, as well as their keen intellect and strategic mind. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 01-05 | Grimsnarl | This bugbear's fur is a dirty brown color and its eyes are a piercing yellow. Its long arms end in sharp claws and its snarling face reveals jagged teeth. |
| 06-10 | Grobb | With matted black fur and a hulking form, this bugbear has a prominent scar above its lip. It carries a crude club and wears a necklace of teeth. |
| 11-15 | Rikkitar | Outfitted in a patchwork collection of furs and leathers, this bugbear stands taller than most of its kin. Its head is adorned with a crown of antlers and its expression is one of cruel amusement. |
| 16-20 | Gurtok | This bugbear is notable for its missing eye, which was gouged out in a long-ago battle. It wears a scratched and dented breastplate and carries a large, battle-worn shield. |
| 21-25 | Vorgok | With a barrel chest and a sharp-toothed grin, this bugbear is known for its insatiable appetite, even by the standards of its kin. It can usually be found in the midst of a pile of stolen foodstuff. |
| 26-30 | Fekk | This bugbear is fond of tinkering with all manner of machinery, and often has a smattering of grease or oil smeared across its fur. It wears goggles on its forehead and carries a small assortment of tools. |
| 31-35 | Krag | With a ragged patch of fur around one eye, Krag is especially tough-looking even for a bugbear. It wields a pair of wicked-looking axes and is often surrounded by a gang of lackeys. |
| 36-40 | Razzle | This bugbear's fur is a rich shade of chestnut, and it often wears a look of thoughtfulness on its brutish face. It carries a worn journal and a dented quill, and is known by reputation to be something of a strategist. |
| 41-45 | Garg | Towering and heavily muscled, Garg is an intimidating figure even among his kind. Its fur is a dark, matted grey, and it is often seen clad in layers of fur and chainmail. |
| 46-50 | Zog | Zog is covered in a patchwork of scars of unknown origin, and its fur is a sickly shade of green. It is known to be particularly cruel, and is often found torturing captives with sadistic glee. |
| 51-55 | Kragnor | This bugbear is particularly fleet-footed, even for one of its kind. It carries a pair of long, slender daggers and often employs hit-and-run tactics in combat. |
| 56-60 | Torg | Torg is particularly ugly, even for a bugbear, with a lopsided jaw and a misshapen nose. Despite its appearance, however, it is known to be a persuasive negotiator and is often called upon to handle delicate diplomatic matters. |
| 61-65 | Ug | With a thick, powerful build and a prominent underbite, Ug is a formidable opponent in combat. However, it is known to have a soft spot for children, and has been seen to occasionally provide aid to lost or stranded youngsters. |
| 66-70 | Snik | Snik is smaller than most bugbears, but it makes up for its lack of size with cunning and intellect. It often works as a scout or spy, and has been known to give strategy advice to leaders higher up the chain of command. |
| 71-75 | Grog | With a brutish, low forehead and a snarling expression, Grog is the epitome of the stereotypical bugbear. It carries a crude, spiked club and frequently engages in pointless acts of violence. |
| 76-80 | Zik | Zik is something of a scoundrel, even by bugbear standards. It frequently engages in underhanded tactics such as using poison or dirty fighting. It is often found in the company of similarly amoral rogues and criminals. |
| 81-85 | Grubnub | This bugbear is notorious for its poor hygiene and foul smell. It frequently wears a wide grin and is known to be particularly vicious and cruel in battle. |
| 86-90 | Grimtusk | With a long, powerful set of tusks, Grimtusk strikes fear in the hearts of many. It often carries a giant meat cleaver as a weapon, and is rumored to be something of a cannibal. |
| 91-95 | Rorag | Rorag has a particularly large and muscular build, even for a bugbear. It is known for its almost unbreakable stubbornness and often refuses to back down, even in the face of overwhelming odds. |
| 96-00 | Throg | With a massive, muscular frame and a rumbling voice, Throg is the very embodiment of brute strength. It is often used as a shock trooper in battle, and is known for its devastating, bone-crushing attacks. |

## Changeling

Chatbot reponse terminated unexpectedly: : The request was canceled due to the configured HttpClient.Timeout of 100 seconds elapsing.

System message: : You are a game master who helps other game masters develop rolltables to help them run their games.  Responses should be limited to what was specifically asked for.  Do not include introduction or closing text.  All generated tables should be in markdown format.  Do not surround any markdown text with fenced code blocks.

User message: : Generate a d100 rolltable in markdown format for the following:
Topic: NPC names and descriptions
Race: Changeling
Genre: Fantasy
Game System: Dungeons and Dragons 5e
Sentiment: On a sentiment scale of 1 to 10, where 1 represents a very precise and serious reponse and 10 represents a whimsical reponse, please generate reponses with a sentiment rating of 2
Table Structure: Table should have three columns: dice value, name, description.

## Dragon
